About Us

• Wardrobe Wizard was created by a team of{" "} three undergraduate students {" "} located in{" "} Tampa, Florida {" "} that got together and built a large-scale project to showcase our technical skills in{" "} web development, database management, and data science

• Our vision for Wardrobe Wizard is a way of{" "} making fashion accessible {" "} for everyone, while{" "} promoting shopping secondhand {" "} to combat the dangerous and wasteful trends of fast fashion flooding retail stores today{" "}

• Thank you so much for using our website! If you're interested in how everything works on a technical level, please check out our comprehensive video documentation:{" "} Here

Our Developers

Logan White

Fullstack Development

Project Manager

{ window.open( "https://www.linkedin.com/in/lwhite49", "_blank", "noopener,noreferrer" ); }} className="Dev-Display-Link" src={LinkedInImg} alt="LinkedIn" /> { window.open( "https://github.com/LWhite49", "_blank", "noopener,noreferrer" ); }} className="Dev-Display-Link" src={GithubImg} alt="Github" /> { window.open( "mailto:lwhite4965@outlook.com", "_blank", "noopener,noreferrer" ); }} className="Dev-Display-Link" src={EmailImg} alt="Email" />

{ window.open( "https://www.linkedin.com/in/luke-lacsamana/", "_blank", "noopener,noreferrer" ); }} className="Dev-Display-Link" src={LinkedInImg} alt="LinkedIn" /> { window.open( "https://github.com/Ynot400", "_blank", "noopener,noreferrer" ); }} className="Dev-Display-Link" src={GithubImg} alt="Github" /> { window.open( "mailto:lacsamanajoshua405@gmail.com", "_blank", "noopener,noreferrer" ); }} className="Dev-Display-Link" src={EmailImg} alt="Email" />

Tech Stack

Database Management

• Our Database is populated with a Web Scraper that utilizes the Puppeteer NodeJS Library, sourcing around 300 articles per minute when active{" "}

• NoSQL Database is hosted on MongoDB for its flexible collection structure, as well as compatability with Mongoose and PyMongo{" "}

• Time to Live Indexes are used to automatically delete articles after two weeks, keeping the database fresh and up-to-date{" "}

Backend Development

• Our Backend Server is built with the Express NodeJS Library, modeled as a RestAPI to handle real time data requests to serve the Outfit Feed{" "}

• All Image Processing and Machine Learning processes are handled in Python, utilizing the Child Process NodeJS Library to communicate between the two languages{" "}

Image Processing

• Used OpenCV functions to process image data into optimal format, including the resizing, flattening, and shifting of color space{" "}

• Applied U2-Net object detection to segment salient clothing items from images with backgrounds of varying levels of clutter and negative space{" "}

• Quantized image data into their most prominent distinct colors via K-Means Clustering{" "}

Machine Learning

• MongoDB Database stores live reactions to outfits from users, archiving individual item data in dimensional collections{" "}

• The Machine Learning model is trained Pandas to join and clean this data, applying functional color theory to engineer useful feature vectors that describe the relationships between individual items{" "}

• Specifically, scikit-learn is used to train a random forest classifier on this data, saving the fitted model to predict liked outfits out of a pool of new items at runtime{" "}

Frontend Development

• Our Website is built with ReactJS in order to utilize its component structuring, as well as the vast library of tools for both functionality and visual presentation{" "}

• The Frontend utilizes several industry standard Libraries like React Query and Axios to handle API Requests, and React Router DOM to handle App Routing{" "}

• Open Source Styling Components like Wavify and Image Sliders are used in combination with traditional CSS Styling to achieve the desired UI/UX{" "}
